A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I keep coming back to this comparison to Man of Steel/Batman V. Superman... In that the latter was clearly a response to the former. Dawn of Justice was a direct result of people complaining about the conclusion of Man of Steel\, and the film's redundant nature in general. Likewise\, the overwhelming gripe people seemed to have with Abrams' excellent sequel was that it was too similar to things that came before. Well\, in response\, Johnson aims for left field and stifles those complaints in truly compelling fashion. It's not perfect\, but it is for sure different. And let's all remember: We asked for this.
